content.title: Pre-Matric Scholarship
content.department: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
content.details: Education is top seeded to uplift the backward classes. Because of lack of education, a social category remains backward. Inspite of long duration passed since independence of the country, expected improvement is not seen in the educational status of Other Backward Classes. Many efforts have been made to improve the educational status. At present, Fee Reimbursement scheme is being operated in online mode by Department of Backward Classes Welfare with the objective of development of backward classes and uplifting their educational status. Under this scheme, students of Other Backward Classes studying in all government schools, aided and recognized educational institute are being provided with the scholarship each year. Department of Backward Classes Welfare is continuously working to uplift the educational status of backward classes.
benefits: Monthly Rs. 150/- for a maximum of 10 months.
Annually Rs. 750/- ad hoc grant in one go.
eligibility: Native and studying in Uttar Pradesh.
Annual income of the parents/guardians of the students upto Rs. 2 Lakh.
Students studying in government schools, aided and recognized educational institutes (provided the availability of the budget).
documents_required: UP Residential Proof: Students can upload any of the following documents- Ration card, Aadhaar card, Voter ID, driving license, or PAN card.
Student ID proof is issued by the educational institution.
Current year fee receipt/admission letter issued by the educational institution.

faqs.question: What is pre-matric Scholarship?
faqs.answer: The scholarship is designed to provide OBC students with the necessary financial resources to study at the pre-matric stage to enable them to complete their education.

faqs.question: What are the benefits?
faqs.answer: Financial Assistance is provided to students on a monthly and annual basis.

faqs.question: How much amount is provided as scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: Monthly Rs. 150/- for a maximum of 10 months. Annually ad hoc grant of Rs. 750/- in one go.

faqs.question: Who Can Get The Benefits?
faqs.answer: Uttar Pradesh native student, who fulfills the eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: What Is The Annual Income Eligibility Criteria For The Scheme?
faqs.answer: Annual income of the parents/guardians of the students upto Rs. 2 Lakh.

faqs.question: What Is The Cast Criteria For The Scheme?
faqs.answer: The students Must be from the OBC category.

faqs.question: Is This Scheme Only For Student?
What Is The Application Process?
faqs.answer: Students have to visit the official website. Complete the registration process. Application form. Submit.

faqs.question: What Is The Official Portal For Registration?
What Are The Required Document?
faqs.answer: UP Residential Proof: Students can upload any of the following documents- Ration card, Aadhaar card, Voter ID, driving license, or PAN card. Student caste certificate. Family income certificate. Student ID proof is issued by the educational institution. Mark sheets of qualifying examination. Current year fee receipt/admission letter issued by the educational institution. Student bank passbook.
